p: Dengue specific antibodies (IgM and IgG) was 69.23%. IgM was found positive in 15% (n = 39) and IgG in 66.15% (n = 172). These findings suggest an appreciable level of Dengue fever transmission in urban center of Accra. This observed level of Dengue virus exposure was comparable to that seen in endemic countries in Central America and South-East Asia [ 13, 14]. Detected IgG antibodies (66.15%) was higher than what was observed in similar studies in Kenya, (12.5%) [ 15], Sudan (9.4%) [ 16] and Ghana (21.6%) where the sero-prevalence DENV in malaria positive children was determined [ 17]. Prevalence of anti-Dengue IgG antibodies was highest among patients in the age bracket of 21–30 years than the other age groups. This finding was consistent with previous studies in Zambia and Burkina Faso [ 18, 19] but different from the pattern seen in Sudan where children between 5 and 14 years old were found to be the most affected [ 16].
